heading: passage: cal ripken sr., 63
subheading: his son achieved baseball immortality by breaking lou gehrig's consecutive-games-played record, but ripken sr. was a solid baseball man in his own right. as a player, coach, manager, and scout, ripken spent 36 years in the baltimore orioles organization. two sons, cal jr. and billy, became major leaguers and the elder ripken is the only man in baseball history to manage two sons at the same time. both were at his bedside thursday when he died of lung cancer.
